meanings.definition: Present (a play, ballet, or other performance) again or in a different way.
meanings.sent1: The theater group decided to restage their popular play for the school assembly.
meanings.sent2: After some changes, they will restage the ballet next weekend for the audience.
meanings.sent3: The director's idea to restage the play with animals instead of actors was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to restage her life like a well-rehearsed play, with a new script and different actors.
meanings.sent5: The decision to restage the concert in the park made the event more exciting and memorable.

meanings.definition: To set the stage again for a performance.
meanings.sent1: The crew worked tirelessly to restage the set for the upcoming show.
meanings.sent2: They had to restage the entire scene due to a technical issue during the rehearsal.
meanings.sent3: The actors had a good laugh when they had to restage the final scene multiple times.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a chaotic theater, needing to restage the scenes for clarity.
meanings.sent5: The team had to restage the play in record time, but they pulled it off seamlessly.
